content:
Following up on a loading indicator animation being added in #22311, Tim Abbott has suggested changing the message on the page to say: "If the Zulip app doesn't load, try reloading the page," and removing the "Loading..." word below the spinner.

Thoughts? For reference, at present you first see:

Screen-Shot-2023-01-27-at-12.47.18-PM.png

And then the text below appears:

Screen-Shot-2023-01-27-at-12.47.23-PM.png
So in this proposal, you would just see the spinner at first.
It sounds reasonable to me, but I wanted to run it by everyone in case there are concerns or suggestions.
Seems reasonable to me. The animation pretty well conveys the information that Zulip is loading; and if it doesn't, we have the more explicit text that appears when that becomes actionable anyway.

I'm ambivalent on if we get rid of "Loading..."

I think it's easier for end-users to judge if the "message went away," than if the "Zulip app load[ed]," so I prefer the current wording, I think?

Alex Vandiver said:

I think it's easier for end-users to judge if the "message went away," than if the "Zulip app load[ed]," so I prefer the current wording, I think?

Ah, I missed that part of the change. I agree with this reasoning.
Judging by Tim Abbott 's comment, he felt that it would be useful to mention loading somewhere if "Loading..." was gone, but we could also leave that sentence as-is if we think that's fine.

Yeah I guess I hadn't been thinking that "this message" would refer to the message at the bottom, but I think that makes sense if there's no other text on the page.

So just removing "Loading..." works for me.

So just removing "Loading..." works for me.

Cool. @Aman (amanagr) would you be up for putting up a quick PR?
Cool, merged this, it'll be included in the next deployment.
